sub_steps.name: Prepare the Paneer
sub_steps.desc: Cut paneer (Indian cottage cheese) into cubes and lightly fry them until golden brown. Drain and set aside.

sub_steps.name: Prepare the Base
sub_steps.desc: In a pan, heat butter and add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add chopped onions, ginger, and garlic. Sauté until golden brown.

sub_steps.name: Create the Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates. Then, add red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, and a pinch of sugar. Mix well and cook the spices.

sub_steps.name: Blend and Cook
sub_steps.desc: Let the mixture cool slightly, then blend it into a smooth paste. Return the paste to the pan, add cream and a bit of water to adjust consistency. Cook for a few minutes.

sub_steps.name: Add Paneer
sub_steps.desc: Gently add the fried paneer cubes into the sauce. Simmer for a few minutes to let the flavors meld.

sub_steps.name: Finish with Butter and Cream
sub_steps.desc: Add a small piece of butter and more cream to enhance the richness. Stir well and cook for a final few minutes.

sub_steps.name: Garnish and Serve
sub_steps.desc: Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve the Paneer Butter Masala hot with naan or rice.

sub_steps.name: Ingredient Preparation
sub_steps.desc: Prepare the Ingredients by cutting paneer into cubes, chopping onions, tomatoes, and bell peppers, and crushing ginger and garlic.

sub_steps.name: Spice Infusion
sub_steps.desc: Infuse the rich aroma of the dish by dry roasting coriander seeds, cumin seeds, and dried red chilies in a kadhai.

sub_steps.name: Spice Transformation
sub_steps.desc: Transform the roasted spices into a flavorful coarse powder.

sub_steps.name: BAromatic Base
sub_steps.desc: Create an aromatic base by heating oil in the kadhai, sautéing crushed ginger-garlic until fragrant, then adding chopped onions and cooking until they turn golden.

sub_steps.name: Tomato Fusion
sub_steps.desc: Fuse the tangy sweetness of tomatoes with the base by introducing chopped tomatoes, salt, turmeric, and the ground spice powder to the kadhai, and cook until the tomatoes become soft.

sub_steps.name: Paneer and Peppers
sub_steps.desc: Incorporate the star ingredients by adding paneer cubes and chopped bell peppers to the mixture, tossing and cooking until they are well-cooked.

sub_steps.name: Finishing Touch
sub_steps.desc: Give the finishing touch to the Kadhai Paneer by garnishing it with chopped coriander leaves, and serve it hot alongside naan or roti.

sub_steps.name: Prepare the Paneer
sub_steps.desc: Cut paneer (Indian cottage cheese) into cubes and lightly fry them until golden brown. Drain and set aside.

sub_steps.name: Prepare the Base
sub_steps.desc: In a pan, heat butter and add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add chopped onions, ginger, and garlic. Sauté until golden brown.

sub_steps.name: Create the Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Add tomato puree and cook until the oil separates. Then, add red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, and a pinch of sugar. Mix well and cook the spices.

sub_steps.name: Blend and Cook
sub_steps.desc: Let the mixture cool slightly, then blend it into a smooth paste. Return the paste to the pan, add cream and a bit of water to adjust consistency. Cook for a few minutes.

sub_steps.name: Add Paneer
sub_steps.desc: Gently add the fried paneer cubes into the sauce. Simmer for a few minutes to let the flavors meld.

sub_steps.name: Finish with Butter and Cream
sub_steps.desc: Add a small piece of butter and more cream to enhance the richness. Stir well and cook for a final few minutes.

sub_steps.name: Garnish and Serve
sub_steps.desc: Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve the Paneer Butter Masala hot with naan or rice.

sub_steps.name: Blanch Spinach
sub_steps.desc: Boil spinach leaves briefly, then plunge them into ice water to retain color and nutrients.

sub_steps.name: Prepare Paneer
sub_steps.desc: Cut paneer (Indian cottage cheese) into cubes and lightly fry until golden brown.

sub_steps.name: Sauté Aromatics
sub_steps.desc: In a pan, sauté cumin seeds, chopped onions, and garlic until onions are translucent.

sub_steps.name: Blend Spinach
sub_steps.desc: Blend blanched spinach with green chilies and make a smooth puree.

sub_steps.name: Cook Spinach Base
sub_steps.desc: Add the spinach puree to the sautéed mixture, season with spices, and cook until the oil separates.

sub_steps.name: Add Paneer
sub_steps.desc: Gently add the fried paneer cubes to the spinach base and simmer for a few minutes.

sub_steps.name: Finish with Cream
sub_steps.desc: Drizzle in some cream for richness and stir gently. Your palak paneer is ready to be served with naan or rice!

sub_steps.name: Marinate Chicken
sub_steps.desc: Mix yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, spices, and marinate chicken for 1 hour.

sub_steps.name: Sear Chicken
sub_steps.desc: Cook marinated chicken until browned. Set aside

sub_steps.name: Prepare Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Sauté spices and onion. Add tomato puree, cook until oil separates. Blend the mixture.

sub_steps.name: Simmer Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Return blended sauce to skillet. Add cream, sugar. Simmer for 5-7 minutes.

sub_steps.name: Add Chicken
sub_steps.desc: Place cooked chicken in the sauce, simmer for 5-10 minutes.

sub_steps.name: Garnish
sub_steps.desc: Remove from heat, garnish with cilantro.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Enjoy the creamy butter chicken with rice or naan.

sub_steps.name: Sauté Aromatics
sub_steps.desc: Heat oil, sauté onions until golden. Add ginger-garlic paste, sauté briefly.

sub_steps.name: Add Spice
sub_steps.desc: Stir in cumin, coriander, turmeric, red chili powder. Cook for a minute.

sub_steps.name: Tomato Base
sub_steps.desc: Add diced tomatoes. Cook until they soften and oil separates.

sub_steps.name: Tenderize Chicken
sub_steps.desc: Put in chicken pieces, season with salt. Cook until chicken turns white.

sub_steps.name: Simmer
sub_steps.desc: Add water as needed. Cover and simmer until chicken is cooked through.

sub_steps.name: Garnish
sub_steps.desc: Sprinkle fresh cilantro on top.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Your Quick and Tasty Chicken Curry is ready to be enjoyed with rice or bread.

sub_steps.name: Marinate
sub_steps.desc: Soak chicken in buttermilk for 1+ hours.

sub_steps.name: Coat
sub_steps.desc: Mix flour and spices in a dish. Dredge marinated chicken in mixture.

sub_steps.name: Rest
sub_steps.desc: Let coated chicken rest for 15-20 minutes.

sub_steps.name: Heat
sub_steps.desc: Heat 2 inches of oil to 350°F (175°C).

sub_steps.name: Fry
sub_steps.desc: Fry chicken 10-12 mins, turning, until golden and cooked (165°F/74°C).

sub_steps.name: Drain
sub_steps.desc: Remove fried chicken, drain on paper towels.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Enjoy the crispy goodness of your Classic Fried Chicken!

sub_steps.name: Prep Wings
sub_steps.desc: Pat dry chicken wings with paper towels to remove excess moisture.

sub_steps.name: Season
sub_steps.desc: In a bowl, combine oil, salt, black pepper, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder.

sub_steps.name: Coat Wings
sub_steps.desc: Toss wings in the seasoning mixture until evenly coated.

sub_steps.name: Air Dry
sub_steps.desc: Place coated wings on a wire rack and let them air dry in the refrigerator for about 1 hour. This step enhances crispiness.

sub_steps.name: Preheat
sub_steps.desc: Oven: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).

sub_steps.name: Bake
sub_steps.desc: Arrange wings on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake for 40-45 minutes, turning halfway, until golden and crispy.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Serve your Easy Crispy Chicken Wings with dipping sauces and enjoy!     s

sub_steps.name: Marinate Chicken
sub_steps.desc: Combine yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, and a pinch of salt. Marinate chicken for at least 30 minutes.

sub_steps.name: Blend Cashews
sub_steps.desc: In a blender, blend soaked cashew nuts to a smooth paste. Add a splash of water if needed.

sub_steps.name: Sauté Onion
sub_steps.desc: In a pan, heat ghee/butter. Sauté sliced onion until golden brown.

sub_steps.name: Add Spices
sub_steps.desc: Add cumin, coriander, turmeric, and garam masala. Sauté briefly until fragrant.

sub_steps.name: Cook Chicken
sub_steps.desc: Add marinated chicken, sear until lightly browned on all sides.

sub_steps.name: Creamy Base
sub_steps.desc: Pour in the cashew paste and heavy cream. Stir well to combine.

sub_steps.name: Garnish and Serve
sub_steps.desc: Serve your Creamy Mughlai Chicken garnished with saffron-soaked milk and chopped fresh coriander. Pair with naan or fragrant rice.

sub_steps.name: Preheat Oven
sub_steps.desc: Heat to 500°F (260°C).

sub_steps.name: Roll Dough
sub_steps.desc: Flatten dough on floured surface.

sub_steps.name: Add Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Spread sauce, leaving border.

sub_steps.name: Top with Cheese
sub_steps.desc: Place mozzarella on sauce.

sub_steps.name: Bake
sub_steps.desc: Cook 10-12 mins until crust is golden and cheese melts.

sub_steps.name: Add Basil
sub_steps.desc: Place fresh basil on hot pizza.

sub_steps.name: Enjoy
sub_steps.desc: Slice and savor the deliciousness of your Margherita Pizza.

sub_steps.name: Preheat Oven
sub_steps.desc: Preheat your oven to its highest temperature, typically around 500°F (260°C).

sub_steps.name: Roll Dough
sub_steps.desc: Preheat your oven to its highest temperature, typically around 500°F (260°C).

sub_steps.name: Spread Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Place rolled-out dough on a baking sheet or pizza stone. Spread tomato sauce evenly, leaving a small edge for the crust.

sub_steps.name: Add Cheese
sub_steps.desc: Sprinkle shredded mozzarella over the sauce.

sub_steps.name: Place Pepperoni
sub_steps.desc: Arrange pepperoni slices evenly on top of the cheese.

sub_steps.name: Bake
sub_steps.desc: Transfer the pizza to the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

sub_steps.name: Finish and Serve
sub_steps.desc: Remove the pizza from the oven, drizzle with olive oil, and sprinkle dried oregano on top. If you like some heat, add optional red pepper flakes.

sub_steps.name: Preheat Oven
sub_steps.desc: Preheat your oven to its highest setting, usually around 500°F (260°C).

sub_steps.name: Roll Dough
sub_steps.desc: Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.

sub_steps.name: Spread Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Place rolled-out dough on a baking sheet or pizza stone. Spread tomato sauce evenly, leaving a small border.

sub_steps.name: Add Cheese
sub_steps.desc: Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.

sub_steps.name: Arrange Veggies
sub_steps.desc: Distribute sliced bell peppers, onions, mushrooms, and black olives over the cheese.

sub_steps.name: Season
sub_steps.desc: Drizzle olive oil over the veggies. Sprinkle dried oregano, basil, salt, and pepper for extra flavor. Place the pizza in the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted and bubbly.

sub_steps.name: Slice and Enjoy
sub_steps.desc: Slice your Simple Veggie Pizza and relish the vibrant medley of vegetables on a bed of cheesy goodness.

sub_steps.name: Preheat Oven
sub_steps.desc: Preheat your oven to its highest temperature, usually around 500°F (260°C) and roll out pizza dough on a floured surface to your preferred thickness.

sub_steps.name: Mix Cheese
sub_steps.desc: In a bowl, combine ricotta, shredded mozzarella, grated Parmesan, minced garlic, dried oregano, a pinch of salt, and black pepper.

sub_steps.name: Spread Cheese Mixture
sub_steps.desc: Place the rolled-out dough on a baking sheet or pizza stone. Spread the cheese mixture evenly over the dough.

sub_steps.name: Add Spinach
sub_steps.desc: Scatter fresh spinach leaves over the cheese mixture.

sub_steps.name: Drizzle Oil
sub_steps.desc: Drizzle a bit of olive oil over the top.

sub_steps.name: Bake
sub_steps.desc: Transfer the pizza to the preheated oven and bake for about 10-12 minutes, until the crust is golden and the cheese is melted and slightly golden.

sub_steps.name: Season and Serve
sub_steps.desc: Remove from the oven, sprinkle red pepper flakes for a kick, and drizzle a touch of olive oil.

sub_steps.name: Preheat Oven
sub_steps.desc: Heat to 500°F (260°C).

sub_steps.name: Roll Dough
sub_steps.desc: Flatten dough.

sub_steps.name: Spread Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Apply pizza sauce, leaving border.

sub_steps.name: Add Cheese
sub_steps.desc: Sprinkle mozzarella

sub_steps.name: Layer Paneer and Veggies
sub_steps.desc: Add paneer, bell peppers, onions, tomatoes.

sub_steps.name: Season and Bake
sub_steps.desc: Drizzle olive oil, sprinkle garam masala, salt, and pepper. Bake 10-12 mins.

sub_steps.name: Garnish and Serve
sub_steps.desc: Top with cilantro. Add chili flakes if desired. Slice and enjoy Paneer Tikka Pizza's fusion of flavors.

sub_steps.name: Prepare the Filling
sub_steps.desc: Mix finely chopped vegetables (cabbage, carrots, bell peppers) with garlic, ginger, and seasonings like soy sauce, salt, and pepper in a bowl.

sub_steps.name: Sauté the Filling
sub_steps.desc: In a pan, sauté the vegetable mixture until they're cooked but still slightly crunchy. This enhances the flavors of the filling.

sub_steps.name: Make the Dough
sub_steps.desc: Prepare a dough by mixing all-purpose flour, water, and a pinch of salt until it's smooth and pliable.

sub_steps.name: Roll Out Dough
sub_steps.desc: Roll the dough into thin, round sheets using a rolling pin. Cut them into circles of your preferred size (about 3-4 inches in diameter).

sub_steps.name: Fill and Fold
sub_steps.desc: Place a spoonful of the sautéed filling in the center of each dough circle. Fold the dough over the filling to create a half-moon shape and seal the edges with pleats.

sub_steps.name: Steam the Momos
sub_steps.desc: Arrange the filled momos in a steamer basket and steam them for about 10-15 minutes until the dough becomes translucent and the filling is thoroughly cooked.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: erve the hot and steaming veg momos with a dipping sauce made from soy sauce, vinegar, and a hint of chili for added flavor.

sub_steps.name: Prepare Dough
sub_steps.desc: Mix flour, salt, water. Rest 30 mins.

sub_steps.name: Create Filling
sub_steps.desc: Cook minced chicken or veggies with onion, ginger, garlic, and seasonings. Allow it to cool.

sub_steps.name: Shape Momos
sub_steps.desc: Roll dough, place filling, fold, seal.

sub_steps.name: Create Coating Batter
sub_steps.desc: Mix cornflour, all-purpose flour, water, salt, and spices to form a thick batter.

sub_steps.name: Coat Momos and heat the oil
sub_steps.desc: Dip each momo in the coating batter, ensuring it's evenly covered and heat vegetable oil for deep frying.

sub_steps.name: Fry Kurkure Momos
sub_steps.desc: Carefully place coated momos in hot oil and fry until they turn golden and crispy. Drain excess oil on paper towels.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Serve Kurkure Momos hot, accompanied by an array of dipping sauces.

sub_steps.name: Prepare the Filling
sub_steps.desc: Mix finely chopped vegetables, cooked meat or tofu, and seasonings to make a flavorful filling.

sub_steps.name: Make Momo Dough
sub_steps.desc: Create a dough using flour, water, and a pinch of salt, kneading until it's soft and elastic.

sub_steps.name: Roll and Cut Dough
sub_steps.desc: Roll out the dough, cut into small circles, and keep them ready for stuffing

sub_steps.name: Fill and Seal
sub_steps.desc: Place a spoonful of filling in each circle, fold, and seal the edges securely to make momo shapes.

sub_steps.name: Heat Oil for Frying
sub_steps.desc: Heat oil in a pan for deep-frying the momos.

sub_steps.name: Fry the Momos
sub_steps.desc: Fry the stuffed momos in hot oil until they turn golden brown and crispy.

sub_steps.name: Drain and Serve
sub_steps.desc: Remove the fried momos, let excess oil drain, and serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce.

sub_steps.name: Prepare Chicken Filling
sub_steps.desc: Cook and shred chicken, then mix with sautéed onions, garlic, and spices to create a savory filling.

sub_steps.name: Make Momo Dough
sub_steps.desc: Create a dough using flour, water, and a pinch of salt, kneading until it's smooth.

sub_steps.name: Roll and Cut Dough
sub_steps.desc: Roll out the dough into thin sheets and cut them into circles

sub_steps.name: Fill and Seal
sub_steps.desc: Place chicken filling in each circle, fold, and seal edges securely to form momo shapes.

sub_steps.name: Steam the Momos
sub_steps.desc: Arrange momos in a steamer and steam for around 15-20 minutes until fully cooked.

sub_steps.name: Prepare Dipping Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Create a dipping sauce with a mix of soy sauce, vinegar, and chili for added flavor.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Serve the hot chicken momos with the dipping sauce and enjoy your delicious treat.

sub_steps.name: Marinate Meat
sub_steps.desc: Mix meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Marinate for a few hours.

sub_steps.name: Parboil Rice
sub_steps.desc: Partially cook basmati rice with whole spices until it's 70% cooked. Drain.

sub_steps.name: Layer Biryani
sub_steps.desc: In a heavy-bottomed pot, layer marinated meat, parboiled rice, fried onions, mint, cilantro, saffron milk, and ghee.

sub_steps.name: Dum Cooking
sub_steps.desc: Seal the pot with dough or a tight-fitting lid. Cook on low heat (dum) for about 30-40 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

sub_steps.name: Final Touches
sub_steps.desc: Gently mix the layers before serving, ensuring the rice and meat are evenly distributed.

sub_steps.name: Prepare Dipping Sauce
sub_steps.desc: Create a dipping sauce with a mix of soy sauce, vinegar, and chili for added flavor.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Serve the Hyderabadi Biryani hot, accompanied by raita and salan (gravy).

sub_steps.name: Marinate Meat
sub_steps.desc: Mix meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Marinate for a few hours.

sub_steps.name: Parboil Rice
sub_steps.desc: Partially cook basmati rice with whole spices until it's 70% cooked. Drain.

sub_steps.name: Fry Potatoes
sub_steps.desc: Fry the potato halves until they're lightly golden.

sub_steps.name: Dum Cooking
sub_steps.desc: Seal the pot with dough or a tight-fitting lid. Cook on low heat (dum) for about 30-40 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

sub_steps.name: Layer Biryani
sub_steps.desc: In a pot, layer marinated meat, parboiled rice, fried onions, boiled eggs, saffron milk, and fried potatoes.

sub_steps.name: Dum Cooking
sub_steps.desc: Seal the pot with dough or a tight-fitting lid. Cook on low heat (dum) for about 30-40 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

sub_steps.name: Final Touches and Serve
sub_steps.desc: Gently mix the layers before serving, ensuring the rice and meat are evenly distributed and Serve Kolkata Biryani hot, accompanied by aloo (potato) curry and a dollop of mustard-based sauce.

sub_steps.name: Marinate Meat
sub_steps.desc: Mix meat with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, red chili powder, turmeric powder, garam masala, lemon juice, and salt. Marinate for a few hours.

sub_steps.name: Parboil Rice
sub_steps.desc: Partially cook jeerakasala or basmati rice with whole spices until it's 70% cooked. Drain.

sub_steps.name: Layer Biryani
sub_steps.desc: In a pot, layer marinated meat, parboiled rice, fried onions, fried cashews and raisins, mint, cilantro, saffron milk, and a drizzle of ghee.

sub_steps.name: Dum Cooking
sub_steps.desc: Seal the pot with dough or a tight-fitting lid. Cook on low heat (dum) for about 30-40 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

sub_steps.name: Layer Biryani
sub_steps.desc: In a pot, layer marinated meat, parboiled rice, fried onions, boiled eggs, saffron milk, and fried potatoes.

sub_steps.name: Final Touches
sub_steps.desc: Gently mix the layers before serving, ensuring the rice and meat are evenly distributed.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Gently mix the layers before serving, ensuring the rice and meat are evenly distributed.

sub_steps.name: Marinate Lamb
sub_steps.desc: Mix lamb with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, paprika or red chili powder, garam masala, and salt. Marinate for a few hours.

sub_steps.name: Parboil Rice
sub_steps.desc: Partially cook basmati rice with whole spices until it's 70% cooked. Drain.

sub_steps.name: Layer Biryani
sub_steps.desc: In a pot, layer marinated lamb, parboiled rice, fried carrots, fried raisins and almonds, saffron milk.

sub_steps.name: Dum Cooking
sub_steps.desc: Seal the pot with dough or a tight-fitting lid. Cook on low heat (dum) for about 30-40 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld.

sub_steps.name: Final Touches
sub_steps.desc: Gently mix the layers before serving, ensuring the rice and lamb are evenly distributed.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Serve Afghani Biryani hot, accompanied by yogurt-based sauces or chutneys.

sub_steps.name: Enjoy
sub_steps.desc: Revel in the authentic flavors of Afghani Biryani, where the tender lamb and aromatic spices create a culinary experience that mirrors the rich heritage of Afghanistan.

sub_steps.name: Cook Dal
sub_steps.desc: Rinse, drain dal. Pressure cook with turmeric, salt, and 2 cups water. Soften till 4-5 whistles

sub_steps.name: Whisk Dal
sub_steps.desc: Make dal smooth after cooking. Add water if needed.

sub_steps.name: Tempering
sub_steps.desc: Heat ghee/oil, splutter cumin, mustard seeds, asafoetida. Sauté chilies, garlic.

sub_steps.name: Onions & Tomatoes
sub_steps.desc: Add onions. Sauté till translucent. Add tomatoes. Cook till soft.

sub_steps.name: Flavor Dal
sub_steps.desc: Mix in red chili powder and a pinch of salt.

sub_steps.name: Combine
sub_steps.desc: Pour tempering into dal. Mix well.

sub_steps.name: Serve
sub_steps.desc: Simmer briefly. Adjust consistency. Garnish with coriander and lemon juice if desired. Serve with rice or bread.

sub_steps.name: Cook Dal
sub_steps.desc: Boil soaked lentils with water and turmeric. Mash them.

sub_steps.name: Temper Spices
sub_steps.desc: Heat ghee/oil. Sizzle cumin seeds, add asafoetida, garlic.

sub_steps.name: Onions and Tomatoes
sub_steps.desc: Sauté onions till translucent. Add tomatoes, cook.

sub_steps.name: Add Spices
sub_steps.desc: Mix red chili, cumin powder, and a pinch of salt.

sub_steps.name: Combine Dal
sub_steps.desc: Put lentils in, blend with tempered spices.

sub_steps.name: Simmer and Adjust
sub_steps.desc: Let dal simmer. Adjust consistency and salt.

sub_steps.name: Garnish and Serve
sub_steps.desc: Turn off heat, garnish with coriander. Serve with rice or bread.

sub_steps.name: Cook Lentils and Beans
sub_steps.desc: Boil soaked lentils and kidney beans in water until soft.

sub_steps.name: Temper Spices
sub_steps.desc: Heat butter and oil in a pot. Sauté chopped onion till golden

sub_steps.name: Add Purees
sub_steps.desc: Stir in ginger-garlic paste and tomato puree. Cook till oil separates.

sub_steps.name: Spice It Up
sub_steps.desc: Add cumin, coriander, red chili, turmeric, and garam masala. Sauté briefly.

sub_steps.name: Blend and Simmer
sub_steps.desc: Mix cooked lentils and beans into the pot. Add salt. Simmer

sub_steps.name: Creamy Finish
sub_steps.desc: Pour in heavy cream. Mix well and cook for a few more minutes.

sub_steps.name: Garnish and Enjoy
sub_steps.desc: Turn off heat, garnish with coriander leaves. Serve Dal Makhni with naan or rice.

sub_steps.name: Preheat and Prep:
sub_steps.desc: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line tray with liners.

sub_steps.name: Mix Dry Ingredients:
sub_steps.desc: Whisk flour, baking powder, salt.

sub_steps.name: Cream Butter and Sugar: .
sub_steps.desc: Beat butter, sugar till fluffy

sub_steps.name: Add Eggs and Vanilla:
sub_steps.desc: Mix in eggs, one at a time. Add vanilla.

sub_steps.name: Combine Wet and Dry:
sub_steps.desc: Alternate flour mix and milk, mix.

sub_steps.name: Bake:
sub_steps.desc: Spoon batter, bake 18-20 min, toothpick clean.

sub_steps.name: Cool and Decorate:
sub_steps.desc: Cool, frost, decorate as desired.

sub_steps.name: Preheat oven to 325°F.
sub_steps.desc: Mix crumbs and melted butter, press into pan.

sub_steps.name: Beat Cream Cheese:
sub_steps.desc: Beat softened cream cheese and sugar until smooth.

sub_steps.name: Add Eggs and Vanilla:
sub_steps.desc: Mix in eggs, one at a time. Add vanilla.

sub_steps.name: Bake Pour into crust, bake 45 min. Let cool in oven.
Spread Sour Cream:
sub_steps.desc: Spread sour cream on top.

sub_steps.name: Chill:
sub_steps.desc: Refrigerate for a few hours or overnight.

sub_steps.name: Slice and Enjoy:
sub_steps.desc: Slice, serve, and savor your homemade cheesecake

sub_steps.name: Mix Dry Ingredients:
sub_steps.desc: In a bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt.

sub_steps.name: Blend Wet Ingredients:
sub_steps.desc: In another bowl, whisk milk, melted butter, vanilla, and egg.

sub_steps.name: Combine Mixtures:
sub_steps.desc: Add wet mixture to dry mixture. Stir until just combined.

sub_steps.name: Roll and cut
sub_steps.desc: Roll dough on floured surface. Cut donuts using a donut cutter or a round cutter.

sub_steps.name: Heat Oil:
sub_steps.desc: Heat oil to 350°F (175°C) in a pot.

sub_steps.name: Fry Donuts:
sub_steps.desc: Carefully fry donuts until golden, about 1-2 minutes per side.

sub_steps.name: Drain and Glaze:
sub_steps.desc: Drain on paper towels. Glaze with your choice of icing or toppings

sub_steps.name: Prep and Preheat:
sub_steps.desc: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease or line a baking pan.

sub_steps.name: Melt Butter:
sub_steps.desc: Melt butter in a microwave-safe bowl.

sub_steps.name: Combine Wet Ingredients:
sub_steps.desc: Stir sugar into melted butter. Add eggs, vanilla; mix well.

sub_steps.name: Mix Dry Ingredients:
sub_steps.desc: In a separate bowl, whisk cocoa, flour, salt, and baking powder.

sub_steps.name: Combine Mixtures:
sub_steps.desc: Gradually add dry mixture to wet mixture. Mix until just combined.

sub_steps.name: Bake:
sub_steps.desc: Pour batter into the pan. Bake for 20-25 minutes, until a toothpick comes out slightly moist.

sub_steps.name: Cool and Enjoy:
sub_steps.desc: Allow brownies to cool before cutting. Enjoy the gooey goodness!

sub_steps.name: Prep and Preheat:
sub_steps.desc: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a baking dish.

sub_steps.name: Prepare Nut Filling:
sub_steps.desc: Mix chopped nuts and cinnamon in a bowl.

sub_steps.name: Layer Phyllo Sheets:
sub_steps.desc: Lay phyllo sheets in the dish, brushing each layer with melted butter.

sub_steps.name: Add Nut Mixture:
sub_steps.desc: Spread a layer of nut mixture over phyllo.

sub_steps.name: Layer and Cut:
sub_steps.desc: Continue layering phyllo and nuts. Cut into diamond or square shapes.

sub_steps.name: Bake and Syrup:
sub_steps.desc: Bake until golden brown, about 45-50 minutes. Simmer sugar, water, honey, lemon juice in a pan until syrupy.

sub_steps.name: Pour Syrup:
sub_steps.desc: Pour cooled syrup over hot baklava. Let cool and absorb syrup.

sub_steps.name: Knead Paneer:
sub_steps.desc: Knead 200g paneer till smooth, shape into small dumplings.

sub_steps.name: Boil Dumplings:
sub_steps.desc: Boil 4 cups water and 1 cup sugar, cook dumplings 10-12 mins, then drain.

sub_steps.name: Warm Saffron Milk:
sub_steps.desc: Warm 4 cups milk, add saffron, let it simmer.

sub_steps.name: Squeeze and Soak:
sub_steps.desc: Squeeze water from dumplings, soak them in saffron milk for 30 mins.

sub_steps.name: Add Condensed Milk:
sub_steps.desc: Mix 1/2 cup condensed milk with rose water, add to saffron milk.

sub_steps.name: Transfer and Garnish:
sub_steps.desc: Transfer dumplings to dish, pour saffron milk, garnish with nuts.

sub_steps.name: Chill and Enjoy:
sub_steps.desc: Refrigerate for a few hours, then relish your homemade Rasmalai!
